Package logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AIGame
    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a game of Animal Chess.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Game.Coord
      Represents a coordinate of a piece in the game board.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(Piece piece,
                       Game.Coord newPosition,
                       boolean skipPlayerCheck)
        Returns true if a specified piece can move to a new position. Checks if the piece is allowed to move this turn. Checks if the piece is contained in the board. Checks if the piece can actually move to the new position. Checks if the new position is on the board or is a valid promotion. Checks if the new position is either empty or contains an enemy.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to check.
        newPosition - The new position to check.
        skipPlayerCheck - If this is true then return true, even if the piece does not belong to the player who's turn it is.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if the move is valid.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove​(Piece piece,
                       Game.Coord newPosition)
        Returns true if a specified piece can move to a new position. Calls canMove(Piece, Coord, boolean) with skipPlayerCheck false.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to check.
        newPosition - The new position to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if the move is valid.

      • canPlace

        public boolean canPlace​(Piece piece,
                        Game.Coord position,
                        boolean skipPlayerCheck)
        Returns true if a specified piece can be placed in a specified position. Checks if the piece can be placed this turn. Checks if the piece is not contained in the board already. Checks if the piece is in it's player's hand.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to check.
        position - The position to check.
        skipPlayerCheck - If this is true then return true, even if the piece does not belong to the player who's turn it is.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if the placement is valid.

      • canPlace

        public boolean canPlace​(Piece piece,
                        Game.Coord position)
        Returns true if a specified piece can be placed in a specified position. Calls canPlace(Piece, Coord, boolean) with skipPlayerCheck false.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to check.
        position - The position to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if the placement is valid.

      • move

        public void move​(Piece piece,
                 Piece.Move move)
        Performs the specified move on the specified piece.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to perform the move on.
        move - The move to perform.

      • place

        public void place​(Piece piece,
                  Game.Coord position)
        Places the specified piece in the specified position.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to place.
        position - - The position to place the piece.

      • play

        public void play()
        Call each player's doMove method in turn, interspersed with the GameHandler's moveEnd method. When the game is over call the players' gameOver methods.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer​(boolean player2)
        Get the player object specified by a boolean.
        Parameters:
        player2 - The boolean; true for player 2.
        Returns:
        The appropriate player.

      • getPlayer

        Returns the player associated with a specified piece.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The player object.

        The player object.

        public boolean isWon()
        Getter for won.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if game is won.

        Setter for won, available to subclasses.
        Parameters:
        won - The new value for won.

      • getWinner

        public boolean getWinner()
        Getter for winner.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if player 2 is the winner, false if player 1.
